name: thedailybeast
text: NEW: A former Gawker editor suing The Daily Beast is getting help from a set of right-wing trolls, including a Trumpy conspiracy site, white nationalist sympathizer Michelle Malkin, and a company tied to far-right agitator Charles Johnson https://t.co/IH4zMXUMUY

name: thedailybeast
text:
The Atlanta man killed by police during a struggle at a Wendy’s died from two gunshots to the back—and the district attorney has already declared the shooting “unreasonable”
https://t.co/ZrrPFN9Fab

name: thedailybeast
text: UPDATE: Oklahoma State head coach Mike Gundy vows to make “some changes” after running back Chuba Hubbard threatened a boycott over a photo of Gundy wearing an OAN T-shirt https://t.co/ILsm7ktuOW

name: thedailybeast
text: Tucker Carlson laments that Black Lives Matter is now more popular than Trump https://t.co/kd3vraCxFf

name: thedailybeast
text: Three days after Rayshard Brooks was fatally shot by police outside a Wendy’s, his family broke down as they described during an emotional press conference “what was taken away” https://t.co/GZcf845OM7

name: thedailybeast
text: NYPD investigating whether officers ingested toxic material at Shake Shack https://t.co/wValYCQ9FZ

name: thedailybeast
text: 13-year-old involved in fatal stabbing of Barnard University student Tessa Majors sentenced to 18 months in juvenile detention after reaching plea deal with prosecutors https://t.co/FT6PIkZKll

name: thedailybeast
text: RT @MarlowNYC: .@JimmyKimmel: “Trump is very defensive about anything that makes him look weak...‘I wasn’t in the bunker for protection, I was inspecting it!’ ‘I wasn’t shuffling down that ramp like an old man, it was slippery and I ran down it!’” https://t.co/jjiNstIxmE

name: thedailybeast
text: The Supreme Court’s historic anti-LGBTQ discrimination ruling bears plaintiff Gerald Bostock’s name. He tells The Daily Beast he is “thrilled,” and that the fight goes on. https://t.co/XxpFZUTM9j

name: thedailybeast
text: Trevor Noah's emotional plea to cops after Rayshard Brooks' killing: “How long? How much? When is it enough?” https://t.co/tUmkJRqE1a

name: thedailybeast
text: RT @MarlowNYC: .@TrevorNoah: “If you didn’t have a toy gun and were 12 years old in the middle of a park, then you’d still be alive...If you weren’t sleeping in your bed as a Black woman, you’d still be alive...If you weren’t Black, maybe you’d still be alive." https://t.co/Ie6dZ63rly

name: thedailybeast
text:
RT @mattwilstein: “If you didn’t resist arrest, then you’d still be alive.” 

“If you weren’t sleeping in your bed as a Black woman, you’d still be alive.” 

“There’s one common thread beyond all the ‘ifs.’ If you weren’t Black, maybe you’d still be alive.” 

https://t.co/PCHoPw260R

name: thedailybeast
text: The trans ban isn’t automatically struck down by Bostock v. Clayton County. But attorneys say it’s a matter of time before the courts render the same verdict to the Pentagon. https://t.co/KPTgvTSdYO

name: thedailybeast
text:
In the back corner of Milan’s Maggiore cemetery is Campo 87, a field of hastily dug graves where 128 victims of COVID-19 were laid to rest in plots marked only with cheap plastic crosses
https://t.co/VjaVstwzvX

name: thedailybeast
text: Advocates worry that amid a national discussion about the over-policing of black and brown people, it is mostly poor families of color facing extra scrutiny https://t.co/FD3drwDZP1

name: thedailybeast
text: “I am a first responder myself, and I literally have it on a video camera,” a firefighter told a 911 dispatcher as she witnessed George Floyd's arrest. “I just happened to be on a walk so, this dude, this, they fucking killed him so.” https://t.co/Z53Yw52Rot

name: thedailybeast
text: “We must all agree to one fact: He was killed by the Atlanta Police Department,” Tiara Brooks, Rayshard’s cousin, said during an emotional press conference with several family members https://t.co/HqLJ6qUfUV

name: thedailybeast
text: Yep. You read that right https://t.co/dIi2dOfkT8

name: thedailybeast
text: “The policing is an issue, but it’s the least of it. We use the police as surrogates to quarantine these racial and economic inequalities so that we don’t have to deal with them.” https://t.co/fczBnRXBax
